attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/redrapids|@redrapids>: . <https://twitter.com/josevalim|@josevalim>'s work in AD in Elixir is a stunning announcement. AutoDifferentials are the keys to the L in machine learning: how do you get better. AD is about chasing the gradient, the direction of improvement.

I will be watching Elixir as a real player in the ML space.
attachments.text:
. <https://twitter.com/josevalim|@josevalim>'s work in AD in Elixir is a stunning announcement. AutoDifferentials are the keys to the L in machine learning: how do you get better. AD is about chasing the gradient, the direction of improvement.

I will be watching Elixir as a real player in the ML space.

text:
Does this mean they added an AD to Elixir?
I'm noticing a trend in projects. Seems like people have moved away from using haskell to make lisps and are now just writing AD's in every lang they can

elements.text:
Does this mean they added an AD to Elixir?
I'm noticing a trend in projects. Seems like people have moved away from using haskell to make lisps and are now just writing AD's in every lang they can

text: seems like the aim is a JAX clone - the JAX subset is functional so it might work well with Elixir as the base language
